result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen J Kienast was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 60 days after release from custody or penalty of 11 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

With Huber. Concurrent with any other sentence.
Concurrent with:
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Allen J Kienast in court, in custody, with Attorney Zachary Hoff.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Hoff makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER    **CONCURRENT WITH ANY OTHER SENTENCE**

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 60 days after release from custody, alternate 11 days jail if not paid)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**

**DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH**

Attorney Hoff states that the Defendant is currently revoked on another case and is awaiting his revocation hearing. Letter submitted by the victim requesting to have no contact order modified. Victim makes a statement. State would not object to contact with the victim while the Defendant is in custody. State would object to any other contact. Court will modify bond to include no VIOLENT contact. Defendant is not to reside with the victim. Hearing to be set after revocation hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
